trans-unit.source: Service Bus Premium and Standard Messaging tiers overview | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Service Bus Premium and Standard Messaging tiers overview | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Service Bus Premium and Standard Messaging
trans-unit.target: Service Bus Premium and Standard Messaging

trans-unit.source: Service Bus brokered messaging, which includes messaging entities such as queues and topics, combines enterprise messaging capabilities with rich publish-subscribe semantics at cloud scale.
trans-unit.target: Service Bus brokered messaging, which includes messaging entities such as queues and topics, combines enterprise messaging capabilities with rich publish-subscribe semantics at cloud scale.

trans-unit.source: Service Bus brokered messaging is used as the communication backbone for many sophisticated cloud solutions.
trans-unit.target: Service Bus brokered messaging is used as the communication backbone for many sophisticated cloud solutions.

trans-unit.source: With the introduction of the Premium tier of Service Bus messaging, we are addressing common customer requests around scale, performance, and availability for mission-critical applications.
trans-unit.target: With the introduction of the Premium tier of Service Bus messaging, we are addressing common customer requests around scale, performance, and availability for mission-critical applications.

trans-unit.source: Although the feature sets are nearly identical, these two tiers of Azure Service Bus messaging are designed to serve different use cases.
trans-unit.target: Although the feature sets are nearly identical, these two tiers of Azure Service Bus messaging are designed to serve different use cases.

trans-unit.source: Some high-level differences are highlighted in the table below.
trans-unit.target: Some high-level differences are highlighted in the table below.

trans-unit.source: Premium
trans-unit.target: Premium

trans-unit.source: Standard
trans-unit.target: Standard

trans-unit.source: High throughput
trans-unit.target: High throughput

trans-unit.source: Variable throughput
trans-unit.target: Variable throughput

trans-unit.source: Predictable performance
trans-unit.target: Predictable performance

trans-unit.source: Variable latency
trans-unit.target: Variable latency

trans-unit.source: Predictable pricing
trans-unit.target: Predictable pricing

trans-unit.source: Pay as you go variable pricing
trans-unit.target: Pay as you go variable pricing

trans-unit.source: Ability to scale up and down workload
trans-unit.target: Ability to scale up and down workload

trans-unit.source: N/A
trans-unit.target: N/A

trans-unit.source: Azure Service Bus Premium Messaging provides resource isolation at the CPU and memory layer so that each customer workload runs in isolation.
trans-unit.target: Azure Service Bus Premium Messaging provides resource isolation at the CPU and memory layer so that each customer workload runs in isolation.

trans-unit.source: This resource container is called a messaging unit.
trans-unit.target: This resource container is called a messaging unit.

trans-unit.source: Each premium namespace is allocated at least one messaging unit.
trans-unit.target: Each premium namespace is allocated at least one messaging unit.

trans-unit.source: You can purchase 1, 2, or 4 messaging units for each Service Bus Premium namespace.
trans-unit.target: You can purchase 1, 2, or 4 messaging units for each Service Bus Premium namespace.

trans-unit.source: A single workload or entity can span multiple messaging units and the number of messaging units can be changed at will, although billing is in 24-hour or daily rate charges.
trans-unit.target: A single workload or entity can span multiple messaging units and the number of messaging units can be changed at will, although billing is in 24-hour or daily rate charges.

trans-unit.source: The result is predictable and repeatable performance for your Service Bus-based solution.
trans-unit.target: The result is predictable and repeatable performance for your Service Bus-based solution.

trans-unit.source: Not only is this performance more predictable and available, but it is also faster.
trans-unit.target: Not only is this performance more predictable and available, but it is also faster.

trans-unit.source: Azure Service Bus Premium messaging builds on the storage engine introduced in <linkText>Azure Event Hubs</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Azure Service Bus Premium messaging builds on the storage engine introduced in <linkText>Azure Event Hubs</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: With Premium messaging, peak performance is much faster than the Standard tier.
trans-unit.target: With Premium messaging, peak performance is much faster than the Standard tier.

trans-unit.source: The following are a few differences between Premium and Standard messaging tiers.
trans-unit.target: The following are a few differences between Premium and Standard messaging tiers.

trans-unit.source: Partitioned entities are supported in Premium messaging, but they do not function the same way as in the Standard and Basic tiers of Service Bus messaging.
trans-unit.target: Partitioned entities are supported in Premium messaging, but they do not function the same way as in the Standard and Basic tiers of Service Bus messaging.

trans-unit.source: Premium messaging does not use SQL as a data store and no longer has the possible resource competition associated with a shared platform.
trans-unit.target: Premium messaging does not use SQL as a data store and no longer has the possible resource competition associated with a shared platform.

trans-unit.source: As a result, partitioning is not necessary.
trans-unit.target: As a result, partitioning is not necessary.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, the partition count has been changed from 16 partitions in Standard messaging to two partitions in Premium.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, the partition count has been changed from 16 partitions in Standard messaging to two partitions in Premium.

trans-unit.source: Having 2 partitions ensures availability and is a more appropriate number for the Premium runtime environment.
trans-unit.target: Having 2 partitions ensures availability and is a more appropriate number for the Premium runtime environment.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Partitioning Messaging Entities</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Partitioning Messaging Entities</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Because it runs in a completely isolated runtime environment, there is no longer a need for express entities in Premium messaging.
trans-unit.target: Because it runs in a completely isolated runtime environment, there is no longer a need for express entities in Premium messaging.

trans-unit.source: Consequently, express entities are not supported in Premium namespaces.
trans-unit.target: Consequently, express entities are not supported in Premium namespaces.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the express feature, see the <linkText>Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueDescription.EnableExpress</linkText><title></title> property.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the express feature, see the <linkText>Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueDescription.EnableExpress</linkText><title></title> property.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about Service Bus messaging, see the following topics.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about Service Bus messaging, see the following topics.
